result.execSummary:
The defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The cash bond of $500.00 has been applied towards defendant's costs.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation;  Defendant shall obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of probation.  Defendant shall obtain his GED/HSED or diploma through the adult diploma program at agent's discretion.  Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
The jail sentence may be served with huber and good time.  The jail sentence shall be served immediately.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.
Consecutive to: Taylor County Case No. 15CM58

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No factual corrections to revocation packet. Victim rights complied with.  Statement by attorneys.  Statement by defendant.  Court orders 90 days county jail with huber in Case No. 15CM58 and 90 days county jail with huber in 15CM59 consecutive to each other; court costs. Court orders any unpaid costs be reduced to a civil judgment. Court orders 97 days sentence credit.  The clerk and judge will figure out sentence credit for each case.  - rt

records.addlTxt: for Plea & Sentencing held on September 25, 2015 - Lisa M. Weber, RMR, CRR

Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied.  Plea of no contest to count 2.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 2 and orders withheld sentence probation for one year with conditions of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge; counseling as deemed appropriate by probation; obtain/maintain full time employment at the discretion of probation agent; obtain GED/HSED or adult diploma program at probation's discretion.  - rt
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Samuel Rivera-Meza in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint.  Plea of not guilty to all charges.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm. - rt
to Leave the State of Wisconsin on June 4, 2015 - Granted
Victim request and order to remove no contact from Defendant's bond

Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the court. Defendant shall comply with booking procedures at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department. Defendant shall have no contact with G.J.R. - d.o.b. 5-7-90.

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Samual Rivera-Maza appeared in person, in custody.  Interpreter Sworn In.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Court advised defendant of right to an attorney.  Attorney Tlusty requests a $500.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with G.J.R. - dob:  5-7-90.  Court orders bond as requested by the district attorney.  Next court date is June 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.   - rt
